joehung302 wrote:
> > Pass an URL that points to a jar made
> > from the order and seeds.txt (and any overrides) that are in the
> > checkpoint dir you want to recover from (You might be able to just
> pass
> > path to the order file under the checkpoint you want to recover
> from).
> > You may have to edit the order.xml so it points at checkpoint
> directory
> > (I think the attribute is 'recovery-path').
>
> I did that and I was able to create a job and it does look like a
> recovered job. However I'm not seeing any directory been created
> under the jobs/ directory.
The recovered job resumes the crawl?

Did you pass order file to JMX addJob or a jar of order + seeds + 
overrides, etc?  If the latter, it will make a new job *based* on the 
content of the jar. Then you should see new directory under job dir).  
If former, then I believe, it will just use order values as are on 
resumption (Is the resumed crawl running out of the checkpoint directory 
or out of the original job directory?).

>
> Normally when I run a recover from web console I was able to see the
> job directory immediately after I create the job.
>
> It would be a great feature (at least for me) to add a recovery-job
> based on a checkpoint directory.
>
> >
> > If you're doing 'fast checkpointing' (See section 9.4.1 under here
> > http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#checkpoint), 
> <http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#checkpoint%29,>
> you'll
> > have to do some scripting to assemble the bdbje log files before
> the job
> > starts up.  See the manual for whats involved.
> >
>
> No I'm not doing fast checkpointing right now. I can start to see
> the recover from checkpointing takes some time with 13M+ links.
> Would it make big different if I use fast checkpointing?
'fast checkpoint' makes the checkpoints -- as opposed to recoveries -- 
complete faster, often, orders-of-magnitude times faster.  If 'fast 
checkpointing', we don't copy the bdbje logs from state directory to the 
checkpoint directory during the checkpoint (There can be thousands of 
the bdbje 10meg files in any sizeable crawl).

But 'fast checkpointing' requires manual or scripting intervention 
recovering assembling the recovered 'state' directory. See 9.4.1 in the 
user manual: 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#checkpoint.

St.Ack
>  
> Cheers,
> -joe
